revisions.rev:
{{Main|Commemorative coins of Poland}} Poland has a rich selection of [[Gold]] and [[Silver]] commemorative coins. In the year 1999 coins were launched in the series: "Polish Travelers and Explorers", "Animals of the World", "Polish kings and princes", "Castles and palaces of Poland" and various occasional coins. {|class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''Polish Travelers and Explorers:'' Centenary of the death of [[Ernest Malinowski]] (1818â1899){{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/1999/malinowski_10zl.html | title=Centenary of the death of Ernest Malinowski coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-02}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 18,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 23 February 1999 {{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/Homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/1999.html | title=Collector coins and 2 zl Nordic Gold coins issued by the NBP in 1999 | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-02}} | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 250 zÅ {{Cite journal|title=Cennik monet kolekcjonerskich | journal=PrzeglÄd Numizmatyczny |publisher=Stowarzyszenie NumizmatykÃ³w Polskich - Polish Numismatic Society|volume=63/2008 |issue=4 |pages=23â26 |year=2008 |issn=1231-143X |oclc=68734851 }} |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: A stylised globe with the outline of North and South America showing the location of Peru. On the right an image of the Eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. A semicircular inscription above: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA. Below, between two parallel lines, the legend: 10 ZÅ. Under it, the date of issue: 1999. Under the left talon of the Eagle the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: The bust of Ernest Malinowski. In the background a stylised image of a train, bridges and a mountain ravine. Above it, against the background of stylised mountains and bridges, an inscription: 4818 m n.p.m. A semicircular inscription below: 1818-1899/ERNEST MALINOWSKI. On the side an inscription: 100-LECIE SMIERCI repeated twice and separated by stars. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| 150th anniversary of [[Juliusz Slowacki]]'s death (gold){{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/1999/slowacki_200zl.html | title=150th anniversary of Juliusz Slowacki's death golden coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-09}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 200 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Au 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 1,900 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 24 March 1999 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|27.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|15.50|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 5000 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: In the center, an image of the eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. On the left side of the emblem, a semicircular inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA. On the right bottom side, a stylized feather, and a semicircular legend: 200 ZÅ 1999. Under the left talon of the Eagle the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: Left profile of Juliusz SÅowacki. A semicircular inscription: JULIUSZ / SÅOWACKI / 1809-1849. On the side an inscription: 150 ROCZNICA ÅMIERCI repeated twice and separated with stars. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| 150th anniversary of [[Juliusz Slowacki]]'s death{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/1999/slowacki_10zl.html | title=150th anniversary of Juliusz Slowacki's death silver coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-09}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 19,000 pcs / 18,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 24 March 1999 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 250 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: On the right top side, an image of the eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland. Under the left talon of the Eagle the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: The bust of Juliusz Slowacki. A semicircular inscription above: WILK - Canis lupus. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''Polish Kings and Princes:'' [[Zygmunt II August]] (1548â1572){{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/1999/august_100zl.html | title=Zygmunt II August coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-09}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 100 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Au 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 2,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 14 April 1999 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|21.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|8.00|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 4500 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: An image of the Eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland.
